subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Tolerance for Ambiguity: Thriving in the Unknown
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Tolerance for Ambiguity: Thriving in the Unknown.

hook.text: Elon Musk started SpaceX knowing three failed rockets would bankrupt him. The first three failed.

buildup.text: Tolerance for ambiguity is the ability to function calmly when outcomes are completely unpredictable.

discovery.text: Psychologists found that entrepreneurs score far higher on ambiguity tolerance than the general public.

twist.text: It's not fearlessness. High-ambiguity people feel the same anxietyâ€”they just act despite it.

climax.text: SpaceX's fourth rocket succeeded with the company's last dollar. Musk didn't know it would work.

punchline.text: Comfort with discomfort is a founder's superpower.

quiz.question: What does 'tolerance for ambiguity' mean in entrepreneurship?
options: The ability to function effectively when outcomes are unknowable
Ignoring risks entirely to move fast
Preferring uncertain markets over stable ones
